gurmukhi: pwhn ko AsQwlX ko isr nXwie iPrXo kCu hwQ n AwXo ]ry mn mUV AgUV pRBU qij Awpn hUV khw aurJwXo ]26]
transliteration: Paahan Ko Asdhaalyo Ko Sir Nyaae Phiryo Kahhu Haayh Na Aayo|| Re Man Moond Agood Prabhoo Taj(i) Aapan Hood Kahaa Urjhaayo||26||
translation: You had been wandering with bowed head in the temples of stones, hut you realized nothing; O foolish mind ! you were only entangled in your bad intellect abandoning that Effulgent Lord.26.

gurmukhi: jo juigAwn ky jwie auiT AwSRm gorK ko iqh jwp jpwvY ]jwie sMnXwsn ky iqh ko kh d`q hI s`q hY mMqR diRVwvY ]
transliteration: Jo Jougeaan Ke Jaae Outh(i) Aashram Gorakh Ko Tih Jjaap Japaavai|| Jaae Sannyaasan Ke Tih Ko Kah Datt Hisatt Hai Mantra Dridaavai||
translation: The person, who goes to the hermitage of Yogis and causes the Yogis to remember the name of Gorkh; who, amongst the Sannyasis tells them the mantra of Duttatreya as true,

gurmukhi: jo koaU jwie qur`kn mY mih dIn ky dIn iqsy gih lXwvY ]Awpih bIc gnY krqw krqwr ko Bydu n koaU bqwvY ]27]
transliteration: Jo Ko( i)  Jaae Turakkan Mai Maih Deen Ke Deen Tise Gadh Lyaavai|| Aapach(i) Beech Gadai Kartaa Kartaar Ko Bhed(u) Na Ko( i)  Bataavai||27||
translation: Who going amongst the Muslims, speaks about their religious faith, consider him only showing off the greatness of his learning and does not talk about the Mystery of that Creator Lord.27.

gurmukhi: jo jugIAwn ky jwie khY sB jogn ko giH mwl auTY dY ]jo pro Bwij snXwsn dY khY d`q ky nwm pY Dwm lutY dY ]
transliteration: Jo Jougeeaan Ke Jaae Kahai Sabh Jogad Ko Grah(i) Maal Outhai Dai|| Jo Daro Bhaaj(i) Sanyaasan Dai Kahai Datt Ke Naam Pai Dhaam Loutai Dai||
translation: He, who on the persuasion of the Yogis gives in charity all his wealth to them; who squanders his belongings to Sannyasis in the name of Dutt,

gurmukhi: jO kir koaU msMdn sO khY srb drb lY moih AbY dY ]lyau hI lyau khY sB ko nr koaU n bHm bqwie hmY dY ]28]
transliteration: Jau Kar(i) Ko( i)  Masandan Sau Kahai Sarab Darab Lai Mohe Abai Dai|| Leo Hileo Kahai Sabh Ko Nar Ko( i)  Na Brahm Bataae Hamai Dai||28||
translation: Who on the direction of the Masands (the priests appointed for collections of funds) takes the wealth of Sikhs and gives it to me, then I think that these are only the methods of selfish-disciplines; I ask such a person to instruct me about the Mystery of

gurmukhi: jo kir syv msMdn kI khY Awin pRswid sBY moih dIjY ]jo kCu mwl qvwlX so Ab hI auiT Byt hmwrI hI kIjY ]
transliteration: Jau Kar(i) Ko( i)  Masandan Kikahai Aan(i) Prasaadh Sabhai Mohe Deejai|| Jo Kachhu Maal Tavaalaya So Ab Giouth(i) Bhet Hamaarihikeejai||
translation: He, who serves his disciples and impresses the people and tells them to hand over the victuals to him and present before him whatever they had in their homes;

gurmukhi: myro eI DXwn Dro ins bwsur BUl kY Aaur ko nwm n lIjY ]dIny ko nwmu sunY Bij rwqih lIny ibnw nih nYk pRsIjY ]29]
transliteration: Mero Idhyaan Ddaro Nis Baasur Bhool Kai Aur Ko Naam Na Leejai|| Deene Ko Naam Sounai Bhaaj(i) Raatah(i) Leene Binaa Nah(i) Naik Praseejai||29||
translation: He also asks them to think of him and not to remember the name of anyone else; consider that he has only a Mantra to give, but he would not be pleased without taking back something.29.

gurmukhi: AwNKn BIqir qyl kO fwr su logn nIru bhwie idKwvY ]jo Dnvwnu lKY inj syvk qwhI prois pRswid ijmwvY ]
transliteration: Aaaakhanndbheear(i) Tel Kau Daar Su Logad Neer(i) Bahaae Dikhaavai|| Jo Dhanvaan(u) Lakhai Nij Sevaktaahidaros(i) Prasaadh Jimaavai||
translation: He, who puts oil in his eyes and just shows to the people that he was weeping for the love of the Lord; he, who himself serves meals to his rich disciples,

gurmukhi: jo Dn hIn lKY iqh dyq n mwgn jwq muKo n idKwvY ]lUtq hY psu logn ko kbhUM n pRmysur ky gun gwvY ]30]
transliteration: Jo Dhan Heen Lakhai Tih Det Na Maagad Jaat Moukho Na Dikhaavai|| Lootat Hai Pasu Logad Ko Kab-hoon Na Pramesur Ke Goun Gadvai||30||
translation: But gives nothing to the poor one even on begging and even does not want to see him, then consider that base fellow is merely looting the people and does not also sing the Praises of the Lord.30.

gurmukhi: AwNKn mIc rhY bk kI ijm logn eyk pRpMc idKwXo ]inAwq iPrXo isru b`Dk jXoN As DXwn iblok ibVwl ljwXo ]
transliteration: Aankhan Meech Rahai Bak Kijm Logad Ek Prapanch Dikhaayo|| Niaat Phiryo Sir(u) Baddhak Jyon As Dhyaan Bilok Bidaal Lajaayo||
translation: He closes his eyes like a crane and exhibits deceit to the people; he bows his heads like a hunter and the cat seeing his meditation feels shy;

gurmukhi: lwig iPrXo Dn Aws ijqY iqq log gXo prlog gvwXo ]sRI BgvMq BjXo n Ary jV Dwm ky kwm khw aurJwXo ]31]
transliteration: Laag(i) Phiryo Dhan Aas Jitai Tit Log Gado Parlog Gadaayo|| Sribhagvant Bhajya Nadare Jam Dhaam Ke Kaam Kahaa Urjhaayo||31||
translation: Such a person wanders merely with the desire to collect wealth and loses the merit of this as well as the next world; O foolish creature! You have not worshipped the Lord and had been uselessly entangle in the domestic as well as outside affairs.31.

gurmukhi: Pokt krm diRVwq khw ien logn ko koeI kwm n AY hY ]Bwjq kw Dn hyq Ary jm ikMkr qy nh Bwjn pY hY ]
transliteration: Phokat Karam Dridaat Kahaa In Logad Ko Koikaam Na Aihai|| Bhaajat Kaa Dhan Betdare Jam Kinkar Te Nah Bhaajan Pai Hai||
translation: Why do you tell repeatedly to these people for performing the actions of heresy? These works will not be of any use to them; why are you running hither and thither for wealth? You may do anything, but you will bot be able to escape from the noose of Yama;

gurmukhi: pu`qR kil`qR n im`qR sBY aUhw is`K sKw koaU swK n dY hY ]cyq ry cyq Acyq mhwN psu AMq kI bwr Akylo eI jY hY ]32]
transliteration: Pouttra Kalittra Na Mittra Sabhai Thaa Sikkh Sakhaa Ko( i)  Saakh Na Dai Hai|| Chet Re Chet Achet Mahaan Pasu Ant Kibaar Akelo Ijai Hai||32||
translation: Even you son, wife an friend will not bear witness to you and none of them will speak for you; therefore, O fool ! take care of yourself even now, because ultimately you will have to go alone.32.

gurmukhi: qo qn qXwgq hI sun ry jV pRyq bKwn qiRAw Bij jY hY ]pu`qR kl`qR su imqR sKw ieh byg inkwrhu Awiesu dY hY ]
transliteration: To Tan Traagad Hisoun Re Jad PrÃªt Bakhaan Triaa Bhaaj(i) Jai Hai|| Pouttra Kalattra Su Mitra Sakhaa Eh Beg Nidaroh Aais(u) Dai Hai||
translation: After abandoning the body, O fool ! Your wife will also run away calling you a ghost; the son, wife and friend, all will say that you should be taken out immediately and cause you to go to the cemetery;
